attributes.action: Stop the persecution of Zander in British canals, rivers and ponds.
attributes.background: Zander have been in England since 1878 and today hold great interest with anglers as a superb sporting fish. Their effect on tackle trade is marked as so many lure anglers spend a lot of money on all the accoutrements needed to successfully target the species.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of money is wasted trying to iradicate Zander from our waters by the Canal & Rivers Trust and yet modern anglers love to fish for them. Modern lure angling also offers children a great way of enjoying this traditional sport and Zander are a big part of the inner city street angling scene.

attributes.action: Increase funding for investigating tool theft for tradesmen.
attributes.background:
Yet to find a tradesman who hasn't had their tools stolen at some point in their life. It seems like there is very little investigation into tool theft and cases are quickly closed.

Took theft is extremely expensive for the victim and damages our careers and livelihoods.
attributes.additional_details: I want to see the police pay more attention to tool theft and harsher penalties for those caught handling stolen tools.

attributes.action: Ask for 'EU Membership for Individuals', when negotiating leaving EU.
attributes.background: Education
attributes.additional_details:
A choice for individuals who wish 'To travel/study/work ' for Â£4:50 week or any other amount deemed reasonable.
It excludes public health and benefits, if no reciprocal arrangement by the EU, since the main cause of  Brexit was the magnetic state benefits package, allowed by the UK.
This is not designed to encourage mass migration, but to allow individuals to persue visa free travel, and to study and work to broaden their horizons, learn languages and foster good relations.

attributes.action: Re-Open hemel hemstead hospital A&E unit.
attributes.background: Since Hemel Hempstead A&E unit closed, Watford A&E unit is struggling to keep up with patients in Hertfordshire.
attributes.additional_details: It became public ,that on our NHS sources, including a statement from Watford general hospital not to attend to A&E unless necessary and Please call 111 first.

attributes.action: Any member of her majesty's armed forces to be the highest priority for housing
attributes.background: Our service personnel are the providers of the freedoms we enjoy. We owe them everything.  It's time we started delivering. We the undersigned demand that upon any form of honourable discharge, all veterans must be placed at the top of the list for social housing, in the area of their choosing.
attributes.additional_details: We have been failing veterans for far too long. Time to put that right.

attributes.action: Remove all French words from the cover of new British passports.
attributes.background: The vote to leave the EU means people voted to Take Back Control. Control of their borders, their culture and their language. Whether 'Dieu et mon droit' and 'Honi qui mal y pense' have existed as mottos in England for ages is irrelevant. French is an EU language and has no place on a UK passport.

attributes.action: Save ALL of our rural GP surgeries on the Isle of Wight from being closed down.
attributes.background: The Isle of Wight Clinical Commissioning Group [the CCG] has to provide a Strategic Plan. What is of concern is that in today's local press, the Isle of Wight County Press, it states that GP surgeries with fewer than 10,000 patients might face closure, and patients have to go to larger practices.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.iwcp.co.uk/news/news/isle-of-wight-fails-in-bid-to-improve-access-to-gps-57313.aspx

attributes.action: Stop the privatisation of NHS Professionals
attributes.background: NHS Professionals is the in-house recruitment and staffing agency of the NHS. The government is planning to 'seek external investment' for the organisation - i.e. sell it off to a private, profit making company.
attributes.additional_details:
Not only would this hand a private company a successful NHS agency which makes a profit and has an effective monopoly on staffing, it would also divert crucial funds away from the NHS at a time when it is struggling more than ever with successive budget cuts and increasing pressure on services.

Private companies put profits before patients. The Government must not be allowed to sell off yet another part of our NHS.

attributes.action: Repeal the ECA1972 with a commencement order attached.Notify European Council
attributes.background: Repealing the ECA1972 alone would breach the Vienna convention and the Lisbon treaty. A commencement order would allow the act to come into force at the same time as the conclusion of negotiations under article 50 and 218(3) of the Lisbon treaty. Therefore meeting our constitutional requirements.
attributes.additional_details:
The bill can reach royal assent to coincide with the governments policy to withdraw from the EU. When the bill becomes an act the government shall notify the European council of its intention to withdraw and begin negotiations on a withdrawal agreement. The Great repeal act can repeal this act later in the year.
Treaty of Lisbon
Vienna convention
Article 50 High Court ruling
Commons research papers. 13/41,13/42,7793,7702,07212,14/55,7551,07214
Lords select committee.The invoking of article 50

attributes.action: Ban the sale of live Animals in all UK Pet Shops
attributes.background:
It's currently too easy for the general public to impulse buy pets many of which end up being sold, rehomed, surrendered to rescues 
The staff in the pet shops generally do not have the right skills or training for each animal.
All too often profit comes before welfare with many pet shops.
attributes.additional_details:
Many visits to a local (branded) pet shop, none of the staff show any trained skills of being able to deal with each animal 
not knowing how to handle a Budgie or get it out of the cage, 

Sending a Chicken back to the supplier for making "funny nosies" this chicken was going to be sent back to be put down, hanging air freshers in the cages of Rabbits and Chickens.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health First Aid courses more accessible regarding location and cost
attributes.background: Mental Health First Aid courses teach how to identify the signs of key mental health issues, provide initial help and capably guide someone towards suitable support. Despite its benefits, many people haven't heard of MHFA; the course is not affordable for all (Â£300 per person) and centres are scarce
attributes.additional_details:
Mental ill health costs companies Â£26 billion and affects 25% of people, while the annual cost to the NHS is predicted to double over the next 20 years from Â£105 billion. With fast diagnosis and application of viable treatment, this could be alleviated.
Our NCS Social Action project (government scheme run by Catch 22) aims to increase MHFA accessibility, thus enhancing mental health care and awareness, developing community support by removing stigmas and advancing knowledge.
www.mhfaengland.org

attributes.action: To fund research for hidradenitis suppurativa  (HS) to get the knowledge to GP's
attributes.background: I have HS as do many of us here in the UK. HS is a painful skin disease thats courses boil like abscesses that affect the armpit, breast, groin and pubic area. It can effect people mentally as well as physically, like many ive had time of work due to the pain and after having surgery.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered with this diseases for the past 5 to 6 year and havent got any closer to any kind of relief from the pain the past year i have had 4 operations and now the surgeon's will not see me until i have seen the dermatologist, its a daily battle with my pain. Im not the only one that suffers on a daily basis with the pain and embarrassment of this dreadful disease. We need to see more support for people suffering and GP's and other professionals getting the knowledge to help us.

attributes.action: Clarify plans to protect UK Research and Universities from impacts of leaving EU
attributes.background: The prospect of leaving the EU has left the UK's Higher Education and Research sectors - among the country's most successful exporters of services - in damaging uncertainty. Can Government clarify its position on the rights of EU staff, continued research funding, and staff and student recruitment?
attributes.additional_details:
Many staff are EU citizens. Will rights to residence, healthcare, and pensions change?

The UK received â¬8.8bn EU research  investment 2007-13. Will we still be able to lead/join EU-funded collaborative projects  (Horizon 2020 and beyond) post-Brexit?

Fees for EU students at UK universities are currently the same as for British students. Will these increase?

Will immigration rules affect recruitment of new staff? If so, how?

Answers are needed to address damaging uncertainty in the sector.

attributes.action: Establish a Vetrans OAP hospital using Redford Barracks In Edinburgh
attributes.background: A lot of veteran pensioners within the North of England and the whole of Scotland do not see the Royal Hospital Chelsea as a viable option to retire to due to the distances involved for family and friends to visit and the feelings of isolation that this can cause.
attributes.additional_details: Would it not now be a good time with the announced closures of Redford Barracks in Edinburgh that one of the Barracks was gifted by the MOD for the Use of Veteran OAPs adopting the same lines and procedures as the Royal Hospital Chelsea but opened as a tri service arrangement so that old service personnel can retire to a home that meets not only their medical needs but also their needs of comradeship with the knowing that their families are within a short traveling distance for visiting

attributes.action: A better method and understanding when dealing with miscarriage and babyloss
attributes.background:
After experiencing a miscarriage 12 weeks I found the NHS aren't educated or given the right tools to deal with this. 

We need - 

More adequate information, compassion and understanding!
attributes.additional_details:
More adequate information - currently
In my local hospital is an a4 piece of paper. Any sort of leaflet or info pack to let you what is happening and what to expect.

More compassion - it's not a taboo subject and it isn't a something to be ashamed of. 1 in 4 people suffer so why do we feel ashamed? 

Men suffer too - my partner received a day off work for compassionate leave 

We need an all round more compassionate and sensible review of how the NHS deals with a family loosing a baby

attributes.action: Immediate force to combat  suicides in Veterans and Members of our Armed Forces
attributes.background: More Veterans and serving men and women killed them selves in 2012 than were lost during the Afghan war.
attributes.additional_details:
The facts speak for them selves. The deaths are continuing to rise and the government and parliament must make the forming of this force a priority .More Falkland veterans have killed them selves than were actually killed  during the Conflict in 1982.
We demand an immediate force of Veterans and professional people  be made into a new force which will be given priority, to help and stop our veterans and serving forces killing them selves.

attributes.action: Give horse riders more safe places to ride &  make it law to drive past at 15mph
attributes.background: Please give us more safe places to ride and take our horses that are free from the dangers of roads and also making it law for vehicles to pass at 15mph and make it part of driving tests so riders are safer.

attributes.action: Amend the proposed route of HS2, to follow the route of the A42 near to Measham.
attributes.background: The HS2 proposed route has been recently amended. Previously, it followed the existing course of the A42 dual carriageway to the north west of the villiage of Measham. The new proposal takes a route to the south east, passing through housing estates and recreational areas and walkways. Used by many.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/hs2-route-to-the-east-midlands-leeds-and-manchester-set-out-by-the-government

attributes.action: Introduce step-free access to all public houses and bars across the UK
attributes.background: As a disabled person who is a wheelchair user, I strive to live my life as closely as I can to that of an able-bodied person. However I often find when wanting to visit pubs and bars that poor access limits the opportunities available to me.
attributes.additional_details:
Throughout my travels I have find that very few pubs and bars as well as establishments generally have good access for disabled people. The vast majority will often have steps that a disabled person cannot overcome without some form of assistance.

Thus the law should be changed meaning that all pubs and bars must have step free access, in a similar manner to them being 'smoke free'. That would greatly improve the opportunities available to disabled people.

attributes.action: Change the law on child sex offences .
attributes.background: I would like to create a petition to change the law in sentencing on child sex offences. The sentencing should reflect the offence and be minimum life sentencing.

attributes.action: Allow baby's born after 18 weeks to be registered at birth.
attributes.background: My baby was born sleeping at 24+2 and his birth was registered. If I had him days earlier we wouldn't of had the right to have him registered. The law needs changing. I want every baby born from 18 weeks to be registered at birth and parents given a birth certificate.
attributes.additional_details: My baby was born sleeping at 24+2 and his birth was registered. He was classed as a BABY not a fetus. If I had my baby just 3 days before he wouldn't have been. He had a heartbeat that beat in me, He is a brother, and a son. We grieved, and we grieved hard! 3 days would not of made one single difference to what we went through. Every parent has the right to have there baby registered whether its 18 or 38 weeks. There baby was loved, there baby had a heart that beat, there baby was real. It's time the law changed! I want every baby born after 18 weeks to be registered and to have a birth certificate.

attributes.action: Accept the BSA's offer of integrating lone refugee children into private schools
attributes.background:
"More than 220,000 have arrived in Europe this year, seeking safety and a better future. One in three is a child." - Unicef

In May 2016, the BSA (Boarding School's Association) offered the government more than 80 fully-funded places in private schools across Britain. They have been unfilled. Why?
attributes.additional_details: As poignant images and testimonies from refugees who have sacrificed everything to make the arduous journey become ever more common, many choose to avert their eyes in fear of the realisation that they could have done more. The British Government is among those who could do more - for a nation which has long prided itself on charity and helping those less fortunate, the paltry number is a farce. Urge them to collaborate with the BSA to restore this nation as one of the world's leading lights.

attributes.action: A second EU referendum for all including UK citizens living anywhere in the EU.
attributes.background: I along with about 4 million other UK citizens living in the EU outside the UK and the people of the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man were not consulted in the recent In/Out EU referendum. Also many lies were told by the "Brexit" camp. I understand that Oxford's word of the year is "post-truth".
attributes.additional_details:
I came to work and live in Denmark, thanks to our two countries long association and their being in the EEC (later EU) together.

The recent UK referendum on EU membership did not allow the UK citizens in the EU outside of the UK and the  citizens of the Channel Islands and Isle of Man a vote. This is grossly unfair and undemocratic. It surely renders the recent referendum morally invalid.

attributes.action: Make a pensions treaty with South Korea for British people in Korea.
attributes.background: I have been working in Korea for nearly 10 years, and for nearly 8 of those years, I contributed over GBP10,000 to the nation pension scheme in South Korea. However, because there is no treaty for pensions between South Korea and the UK, I am unable to receive that money back in any way.
attributes.additional_details: I also have a number of friends who are in a similar predicament. If we contribute for 10 years to the scheme, we can get it when we are 65. But any less than that and we receive nothing. For me to receive any money at retirement, I would need to work in a private institute for 3 more years possibly, which for me is undesirable.
attributes.creator_name: Mr. James Michael Suddrey BA (Hons); MA

attributes.action: Introduce tighter control of wild boar in the Forest of Dean
attributes.background: There is a lot of debate in the Forest of Dean with regards to wild boar which roam freely in the Forest and how they impact on our lives. Some people love them and some people don't. It is becoming more apparent the boar are causing a nuisance and are not just living deep in the Forest.
attributes.additional_details: Do we want tighter controls?

attributes.action: Any refugee claiming to be a child to have ID, age and criminal conviction tests
attributes.background:
To safeguard our children, teachers and other school workers (indeed everyone), we are calling for rigorous testing of all refugees claiming to be children. 
Dental checks must be carried out to ascertain age and police checks must be carried out for criminal convictions.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been cases were some refugees claiming to be children have been proved to be adults. This has had alarming consequences from commission of serious assaults to fraud where the refugee has claimed free education from the UK tax payer.
All UK citizens have a HUMAN RIGHT to be protected by our government and this type of testing will go some way to aiding this. 
There is obviously some urgency in the government responding to this and implementing rigorous checks before a tragedy happens.

attributes.action: UK to offer free trade deals with any EU country that votes out in a referendum
attributes.background: With the EU starting to fall apart now is the time for the UK Government to offer the EU countries who are about to hold their own In/Out referendums the help and understanding they deserve by offering them a open trade deal with Great Britain if they vote for an exit.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition will have the effect of showing the world we are standing on our own two feet and ready to trade as normal with everybody who is free to trade with us, without the shackles of corrupt trade dictatorships.
It will also send a strong message to those silly billies who want a second referendum, a vote in parliament etc, and continue, in the face of our improving prospects to still continue to run down the UK in order to satisfy their own power aspirations and personal gain.

attributes.action: Stop allowing the NHS to go into decline, put it back  in the public domain
attributes.background: Private companies are charging extortionate fees which are being paid for with public money.  Voters should be asked how they want their money to be to be spent or if they want to use their money to pay for high managerial positions which could pay for training for doctors and nurses.
attributes.additional_details: The speed at which the NHS is being placed into private hands is steadily increasing with more  contracts going to private providers, even when the NHS contracts  cost less for the same services. The money to pay those private companies comes from public money which should be going to the support of the NHS.  By placing the NHS completely in the public hands, Where we are given the ability to make decisions on what happens to our Health Service people would have more respect on how it is used.

attributes.action: Repeal the Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act 2000, used by the BBC to snoop
attributes.background: The BBC uses the Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act 2000, passed by Tony Blair, to snoop on the public to maintain its enormous income and preserve its privileged position to control opinion in the UK, and prevent the public protesting in the only way it can against its biased reporting.
attributes.additional_details: The BBC has a charter to serve the public, and not its own elite. That BBC elite has used its monopoly position to influence the public in every election and has abandoned the original ethos of neutrality in providing information and news. If the public resent this then they should be able to vote with their wallets and the BBC should not be able to use the power of the state to oppress them fom exercising the free will that Englishmen thought was their birthright.

attributes.action: Review Her Majestyâs Revenue and Customs Widening Access claim process.
attributes.background: 1000's of NHS Professionals have been waiting for over a year for the HMRC to process refund claims. The HMRC should be set specific timeframes to process claims. There is evidence of inconsistent information being given by the HMRC to claimants and this is totally unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
Her Majestyâs Revenue and Customs (HMRC) has stated that NHS employed staff also in full-time education are exempt from Tax and NI up to an annual allowance on earnings of Â£15,480, whilst in training, provided they meet certain criteria. Claims for refunds of tax and NI can be made for the period September 1999 to March 2013. 

This process has not been advertised to NHS professionals. The HMRC has made and error collecting Tax/NI and should rightfully correct this with complete transparency.

attributes.action: Allow women with step children to have fertility treatment on the nhs
attributes.background: My Husband has a 10 year old from a previous relationship. I have no children. We have been trying for a baby for 2 years and due to my husband having a child we are not entitled to full fertility tests or treatments on the nhs. I feel as though I am being punished for his past relationship failing.
attributes.additional_details:
We can only have base line testing this means just blood tests to check hormones and a scan to check for cysts etc and a sperm check we are not entitled to any other tests or actual treatment. I feel so alone and like no one will help me in this journey to be a Mum. Every month is devastating and feel so depressed each time we are unsuccessful.
If the reason I felt like this was because I had small breasts I would be entitled to bigger ones on the nhs. But I'm not entitled to help for a baby.

attributes.action: Officially recognise the Armed Forces who provide Aid to the Civil Authorities.
attributes.background: The Armed Forces are increasingly being used to in support of the Civil Authorities for Public Sector Strikes & Emergencies. To allow Armed Forces Personnel to proudly show their service to the community, they should be entitled to the General Service Medal 2008 for official MACA Operations.
attributes.additional_details:
The General Service Medal with a new Clasp "United Kingdom" would recognise the hardship, commitment and readiness to act in support to the community that our Armed Forces display through these short-notice tasks. 

Examples include: Cover for Prison Service Strikes, Flood Relief during Christmas Leave, Replacement Fuel Tanker Drivers, Replacement Fire Service Personnel, Bus Drivers for Public Transport (Train Strikes) and Security to Key Infrastructure in UK Emergencies.

attributes.action: Tv advertisment to raise awareness on using country roads #ThinkCountryside.
attributes.background: There are a increasing number of incidents involving horses and cyclists on our country roads. A Tv advertisement will help raise awareness in educating communities on the dangers of blind bends. Detailed examples on How to pass horses and cyclists safely on the country roads.
attributes.additional_details: An Educational TV advertisement is the way forward in educating all road users to help reduce accidents and fatalities.

attributes.action: Stop trading & supporting India until it stops human rights violation in Kashmir
attributes.background: Draconian laws such as AFSPA & PSA are used by India to commit human rights violations in Kashmir with impunity, over last 44 days of worst curfew imposed in Kashmir, Indian forces have killed over 70+ civilians, 200+ blinded using pellets, including young kids as young as 1 year, injured 8000+.
attributes.additional_details:
Insha, 14 year old is battling for her life due to serious brain injury after been hit by pellets aimed deliberately at upper body.

Essentials supplies like food, water & medicine have been curtailed, communication restricted, an ambulance driver shot while transporting patient to hospital, Lecturer dragged from home and beaten to death. 

We people of Britain have an obligation to put an end to these human rights violations.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for a business or service provider to ban guide dogs.
attributes.background: It is a criminal offence for taxis or private hire drivers to refuse to carry guide or assistance dogs, unless they hold an exemption. This petition calls for parity so the same applies to businesses and service providers. We also call for police to be the prosecuting authority via magistrates court
attributes.additional_details: Currently, unlike for taxis and private hire cars, the law doesn't specifically say guide and assistance dogs must be admitted. This is wrong and leads to confusion. Moreover, other than for taxis. Matters are dealt with personally by the victim, at their cost via the county court. This is not the case for other types of discrimination. We call for a prosecuting authority to take the cases on, on behalf of the Crown.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for the C of E to discriminate against gay non-celibate clergy
attributes.background: The Anglican Church insists that gay clergy with partners live a celibate life if they wish to continue working as priests or bishops. This is an unfair burden on gay clergy as well as being discriminatory within the 21st century workplace.

attributes.action: Award QTS as part of EYITT
attributes.background: EYITT's have to meet the same entry requirements and the same set of rigorous standards as their counterparts who achieve QTS.
attributes.additional_details:
Without QTS, EYT's have found that they do not receive equal stature, pay or recognition for the demanding work that they carry out and their dedication, passion and commitment towards the teaching profession and children and families aged 0-5.

http://www.nurseryworld.co.uk/nursery-world/news/1159248/early-years-pay-and-conditions-survey-2016

https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/eligibility-for-teacher-training

attributes.action: Do not make the British taxpayer pay for the renovation of Buckingham Palace!
attributes.background: Following recent news that Buckingham Palace is to undergo a Â£369 million renovation, it should not be at the expense of the British taxpayer. In a time of perennial austerity where hospitals, schools and the "JAM" (just about managing) families are struggling, surely this renovation is arbitrary?
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/nov/18/buckingham-palace-to-undergo-370m-refurbishment
http://www.thetimes.co.uk/_TP_/edition/news/mps-urge-royals-to-chip-in-for-palace-repairs-6htfxxqpm?ni-statuscode=acsaz-307
http://www.ibtimes.co.in/no-taxpayers-money-britains-citizens-want-queen-elizabeth-pay-370-million-palace-repairs-704963

attributes.action: RAISE ISSUE OF PERSECUTION OF POLITICAL ACTIVISTS WITH MUGABE REGIME IN ZIMBABWE
attributes.background: We ask the UK govt to raise the issue of persecution of activists with the Zimbabwe govt. The last election was hugely rigged. Misgovernance & corruption have destroyed the economy resulting in starvation & 90% unemployment. Civil unrest is growing & protesters refused bail & jailed without trial.
attributes.additional_details: Linda Masarira, locked up since 6 July on trumped-up charges, has health problems & is the mother of 5 children (youngest 2 yrs). Accused of inciting riots in the female section of Chikurubi prison on 10/9, she was moved to solitary confinement in the dangerous male section â we fear for her safety. Other activists are also still incarcerated, many needing medical care after violent treatment by the police. Both Gift Sizibaâs hands are believed to be broken.  This vicious persecution must stop.

attributes.action: Stop the roll out of grammar schools and work to close down current grammars
attributes.background: There has been speculation that the government are looking into lifting the ban on new grammar schools and this would create more inequality than social mobility. In areas where there are grammars, secondary schools receive a lot more Free School Meal funding etc. The grammar system doesn't work.
attributes.additional_details: I recently wrote to Cllr. Zahir Mohammad, Cabinet Member for Schools in Bucks, about funding inequalities between grammars and secondaries and his response was this, "The non-selective schools receive considerably more support from increased funding e.g. per pupil Free School meals, Prior Attainment, English as an additional language and Pupil Premium etc and this can be quite significantly more than grammars.". The 11+ is biased against poorer kids and this system cannot be rolled out further.

attributes.action: Do not bring in a fee/charge to use Recycling Centres nationwide
attributes.background: My local council and I am sure many will follow suit are planning to start charging for certain types of waste brought to the Recycling Centre. I would like the Government to stop this charge as I fear it will encourage fly tipping.

attributes.action: Allow the Help to Buy ISA bonus to be used for deposits for first-time buyers.
attributes.background:
The Help to Buy ISA was set up by the government to help first-time buyers. However the money the government puts in cannot be used as part of the deposit.

As the scheme is supposed to help first-time buyers, the money should be usable for the deposit helping people get on the housing ladder!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-08-20/help-to-buy-isa-scandal-leaves-500-000-first-time-buyers-unable-to-use-scheme-for-deposits/

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/08/19/help-to-buy-isa-scandal-500000-first-time-buyers-told-scheme-can/

attributes.action: I call for a vote of NO CONFIDENCE in this government!
attributes.background: Brexit is causing chaos to the United Kingdom and it's citizens, it is clear, the referendum as presented to the voter was based on lies and exagerations and the government is still continuing this trend, this must stop.
attributes.additional_details: Not allowing parliment to vote on when article 50 will be presented, nor allowing the majority of the United Kingdom to have a rethink, now that they know the real implications of the result of the advisory referendum.

attributes.action: Include ADHD in the Disability Living Allowance SMI Criteria.
attributes.background: Make ADHD automatically an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain for Disability Living Allowance (Severe Mental Impairement Rules). Autism Spectrum Disorder is now automatically accepted as an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain, and ADHD should be too.
attributes.additional_details: ADHD comes little danger awareness and it is extremely hard to bring up a child who does not understand anything about danger, this means they need more help when out and about. To pass the severe mental impairment part of DLA you need to have an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain. ADHD is exactly that however, it is not automatically classed as that. I feel like this condition is too overlooked and we are still stuck in the dark ages regarding our views on it.

attributes.action: To review the sentencing guidelines for offences of deliberate animal cruelty
attributes.background: The existing penalties for animal cruelty are far too lenient and do not act as a deterrent. The sentencing guidelines for offences under the Animal Health Act need reviewing to introduce much tougher sentences for deliberately & wilfully causing suffering and death to animals, eg minimum sentences
attributes.additional_details: Our existing animal welfare legislation is rooted in times when animals were seen as possessions, chattels, or tools of a trade. The current maximum sentences available do nothing to deter the people who indulge in deliberate cruelty for "fun", or who take part in dog fighting or other illegal activities. The introduction of a minimum custodial sentence on conviction of say, three or four years, with no remission or parole, would act as more of a threat to these people and make them think twice.

attributes.action: Stop the benefit cap November 2016.
attributes.background: the benefit cap is not being publicised it Will affect thousands of families and children and will leave people 50 pound worse off or more a week it will come directly from your housing benefit and leave people to make up the short fall.This will leave people homeless or not able to pay bills
attributes.additional_details: Please google benefit cap calculator and select November 2016 to see if you are affected

attributes.action: Principles for negotiations with the European Commission for leaving the EU
attributes.background: Any settlement negotiated by the Government must also be ratified by the British Parliament. Negotiations must seek to maintain full membership of the Customs Union while also seeking access to the single market for service industries including the Financial and IT sectors.
attributes.additional_details:
While seeking access to the Single Market Government should seek to mitigate the effect of disproportionate total migration into the U.K. from other EU member states.

Further, in the absence of a negotiated settlement being ratified by Parliament the Government must put the final agreement to a referendum of the British people for a simple vote either to accept the negotiated terms for leaving the EU or to remain within the European Union.

attributes.action: Drop prescription fees for people with chronic illnesses.
attributes.background: I am a 17 year old girl who has lived with and helped to look after my mum, who has suffered with Parkinson's Disease since 2007. I would like to petition again the fees of prescription charges for people with such diseases, after our local MP refused to help us.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a fee of Â£8.40 per item for medications, for someone like my mum who could pay a potential fee of Â£51.60 a month for a illness that she can not help, or can not be cured. With her "season ticket" she pays Â£132 a year!

In Scotland and Wales, prescriptions are free. Over 65's also do not pay, aswell as people with problems such as diabetes or thyroid disorders. 
This differs from people with chronic illnesses, who often can not work and get less money.

attributes.action: Publish the identity of aircraft used to bomb hospitals in Syria
attributes.background:
On 29 July, unidentified aircraft bombed a maternity hospital in Syria supported by Save the Children.

As part of the Coalition against Daesh, the UK has data on military aircraft flights in Syria. Where data can identify aircraft used to bomb hospitals, the UK should publish their identity.
attributes.additional_details:
Physicians for Human Rights have documented 373 attacks on medical facilities in Syria.

Deliberate attacks on hospitals are a war crime. Those responsible should not be allowed any measure of deniability.

Background: https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2016/07/syria-fatal-airstrike-on-maternity-hospital-a-potential-war-crime/

attributes.action: Introduce meat and dairy taxes to correct market failure in the food industry
attributes.background: Food production causes a quarter of all greenhouse gas emissions that are driving global warming. Both the UN International Research Panel and the Oxford University Martin Programme have suggested pricing in the environmental impacts of meat and dairy are vital steps to combating climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
The Oxford report states average surcharges of 40% on beef and 20% on milk would account for the damage they cause people via climate change and Maarten Hajer, the lead author of the UN report has recommended similar action. We hereby call on the government to implement such taxes to help meet our international obligations to combat climate change. 

http://www.nature.com/nclimate/journal/vaop/ncurrent/pdf/nclimate3155.pdf
